comment: I understand why some people may have given her a bad review but she's not as bad as they make it seem. She's very nice and flexible. If you need an extension, ask. Weekly reflections. No tests, just assignments. Her lectures are heavy so try to keep up but if you can't then thats fine. It's very easy to get an A, just do your work and go to class
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Accessible outside class--Caring

comment: Going to class made me stressed out every week. She seems to be frustrated at students a lot and cannot answer a direct question. This is the worst class I have taken for my major yet. She makes you buy her own book from the bookstore. Dont email her because she wont respond. Please do not take her, because you will regret it if you do.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Tough grader

comment: Dr. S's class was very stressful this semester. Granted it was online because of the world right now but she was still very confusing about due dates and always answered emails as if she did not really care. Her emails were not helpful at all. The class itself was useful and I feel like I learned a lot! Take a different professor if you can
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Skip class? You won't pass.--Tough grader

comment: This class stressed me out but Prof S tried her best to pack everything that is learned in a normal F2F class into an online class and I know that was difficult for her. She threw A LOT of content at us the first month or so weeks but it slowly came together. Ask as many questions as possible, she is patient and helpful. An A is definietl possible.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: The most overwhelming class at KSU. She has so much information, but yet it still doesn't explain what she actually wants. She gives an excessive amount of work that causes you to not actually learn anything from the assignments. My classmates held our own zoom meetings without her because it was easier for us to learn from one another than her.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Most stressful professor I have ever taken. She assigns way too much , and most of it is busy work that we learn nothing from. When we ask for help, she gets an attitude and just tells us to read the calendar. In class, she goes over so much that the entire class is stressing and confused about which assignment she is explaining. Avoid taking her.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read--Lecture heavy

comment: DO NOT TAKE THIS CLASS. Especially online. Nora gives the most amount of work I have ever seen in a class and is extremely unclear with directions. She talks to her students as if we were in elementary school yet expects us to work like we already have our degree. She is not open to suggestion on how she can help us. Avoid her.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Skip class? You won't pass.--Lecture heavy

comment: You will be confused just about everyday she is kinda all over the place! She just throws everything at you and starts lecturing and you can get overwhelmed quickly. Talk to her after class or meet with her virtually, she is willing to do ANYTHING to help you! She truly cares and due dates can CHANGE! You will pass with an A if you try. WORK WORK
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Lecture heavy

comment: This class was very hectic, requires a lot of time and effort. Very tough grader, make sure to listen to every single word she says or youll miss something and your grade will suffer. Always email her if you have any issues or questions, she responds fairly quickly. Lenient with due dates if you make an effort and consult with her before due date
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Skip class? You won't pass.--Tough grader

comment: Honestly in all my time at Kennesaw State (and 3 major changes) I have never had a professor that made my life more miserable. SO confusing, all of us would leave class crying, and honestly the definition of all over the place. Just save your sanity and take another professor. Assigns 100x more work than necessary.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read--Lecture heavy

comment: It was so hard to learn in this class because she does entirely too much, she tries to prepare you for edTPA but she gives way to much work. shes very lenient with due dates but she should be considering how tough she grades. DO THE KWIP CHARTS AND GO TO CLASS both are 20 points each.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read--Tough grader

comment: Dr. S is a good professor, she grades tough for your benefit, not hers. She prepares you for your future in the education program and wants you to succeed. That being said, it is hard to class and you will have to work for it. Never skip or you get so behind, don't be late, work hard and turn in every assignment, and take her feedback!!!!
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Skip class? You won't pass.--Tough grader

comment: She is a nice lady and she knows so much but this lady is ALL over the place. she tries to cram so much into one class that it's very hard to learn. she gives way to much homework along with work that you're required to do in the field. do the KWIP charts and come to class or you will lose 20 points for every missed chart and every absence.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Dr S. a VERY good teacher & knows what she's talking about. She's willing to work you w/any circumstances in your field experience, if you reach out to her. Make sure to attend EVERY class/pay attention, because you'll have group discussions. This class was a moderate amount of work, but well worth it to prepare you to teach reading and writing.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: I cannot find enough kind words to describe Dr. S. She is the only class i have had that has prepared me to be a teacher. Lecture is long. Go to class EVERY day. She knows what she is talking about and is very knowledgeable. She wants everyone to succeed. Best class i have ever taken at KSU. Be ready to learn and work.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--Caring

comment: Lectures are extremely overwhelming and you cover tons of information throughout the semester, but this is probably the only class that I've actually learned from. The class was out of about 2000 points and you have to work hard for every one. Dr. S is intense and moves REALLY fast, but is here to help you succeed.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Clear grading criteria--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: She's a good teacher. Class moves quickly with lots of activities and she covers a lot of material using different teaching techniques. Nora will keep you on your toes so don't fall behind  You won't like the late penalty. Communicate when you have challenges & she will see your effort and probably work with you. Reflections every week!
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Gives good feedback--Get ready to read

comment: She's caring & wants to see students do well. She's flexible with FE dates which was nice. She gives good feedback- the only drawback to the course is how much busy work she gives. Weekly reading reflection & weekly quizzes on top of all the FE work. She also talks to her students like they're little kids sometimes. A if you work for it- easy B.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Skip class? You won't pass.--Clear grading criteria

comment: I can honestly say I've learned a lot in this class. She is extremely passionate and has so much knowledge on language it's crazy. I enjoyed her class the most because she does activities with us that i will do in my classroom. First class I feel like I ACTUALLY learned useful info. Taking her again for 3330!
rating_tags: Respected--Get ready to read--Caring

comment: Nora is a sweet lady, little scatter brained, but sweet. You can tell she really knows her stuff and is extremely passionate about language and how we use it. Her grading can be a little weird, but she's not terrible. Reading reflections every week (those were annoying), but she's not bad and puts smiley faces and stickers on your work :)
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES

comment: I ended up dropping this class halfway through the semester because it was so hard. So much work. She's not very nice, and I didn't feel like I learned anything in that class, probably because I was so stressed all of the time about all of the assignments.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Get ready to read--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: Amazing teacher.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Gives good feedback--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: I loved Professor Schlesinger. She makes you work for your grade. I failed the first lesson plan miserably but after going to her office  she helped me understand what I did wrong and let me correct some of my work for credit. I can say I learned something from her.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Gives good feedback--Participation matters

comment: Professor Schlesinger is great! She is one of the few professors that I have taken in the program that really cared about how well we performed in her class and cared about prepping us for EdTPA. If you're looking for easy then this is NOT the class for you. If you want to be well prepped for the rest of your time at KSU then take her!
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES

comment: This teacher expects you to do at least 2-4 reading reflections a week. So much busy work. Usually gives you an A on reading reflections but on top of that you have lesson plans due every few weeks. She is strict grader. Do not take if you are taking hard classes.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: Literally my hardest education class. You have 2-4 reading assignments due every single week on top off lessons plans and weekly in class quizzes. I have only ever made A's on lesson plans until I took her class. You have to work for your grade, every single point counts in her class.
rating_tags: Tough Grader

comment: I took 3330 and 3320 together because they are corequisets. I believe if I had taken 3320 before this class I would be more prepared but I am taking them at the same time. She says she understands but she doesn't show it. She expects you to know how to write a lesson plan perfectly when you have never written one before. Miss 4 classes and you fail
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: She's terrible. You have a million assignments due every week and she grades SO HARD.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Get ready to read--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: She requires a lot of outside reading and write-up assignments based on this reading. Her lectures in class are long and often boring to follow. Miss class and you'll hear about it for the next few weeks. She is not very understanding and illness is often disregarded.  I would not take her again.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--LECTURE HEAVY
